website_summaries.verdict: With 100 chewable pills, not only is this a great solution to protect small pets and cats from fleas, ticks, and mosquitos by masking the bug-attracting CO2 they naturally exhale, each bottle will keep them covered for a whole 100 days.
cons: Remember, this product repels biting bugs, and will not kill an infestation already on your pet

customer_reviews.title: Using on Feral Cat
customer_reviews.text: We feed a feral cat. When we started feeding him, his face was scratched and infected. We gave him several rounds of antibiotics in his food and it would get better and then start bleeding again. We figured out that he was scratching himself either from fleas or something else. Started giving him the Flea Away and within a few weeks it healed. That has been over three months ago as I just ordered the second bottle. I do have to crush and hide in his food, but he looks great.
customer_reviews.author: DDS

customer_reviews.title: Very effective!
customer_reviews.text: This past year I switched to this product to replace the chemical flea and tick repellent we had been using. I have 4 dogs and I live on 3.18 acres of mostly wooded land. Since using this product, my 4 dogs have been flea and tick free. I do also spray a portion of my back yard with a natural flea and tick repellent, but giving where we live I'm very happy that we didn't see a single bug on my dogs. The pills are a little big and sometimes my dogs wouldn't eat them, so we started breaking them in half and adding to their food. That way they always eat them without any problem.
customer_reviews.author: Francois Bombardier

customer_reviews.title: ... use any of the toxic chemicals that most vets recommend so we started using this after a particularly hellish ...
customer_reviews.text: We did not want to use any of the toxic chemicals that most vets recommend so we started using this after a particularly hellish summer and flea infestation in our two dogs. They no longer are constantly scratching and I no longer see fleas. I highly recommend this as toxic products not only kill the fleas, but can kill healthy tissue.
customer_reviews.author: Elenita

customer_reviews.title: This is all I used this year!! NO FLEAS
customer_reviews.text: I started giving the dogs the Flea Away a few months before flea season. I never had to give them anything else! I was amazed as usually we have to resort to the spot on flea medication. Not this year, of course I shared this with everyone at the dog park. The key is to start before the fleas do, otherwise be patient for about 1 month using the Flea Away and a topical, then just the flea away. It worked for my two dogs. 1 tablet each morning. they are a 13 pound Silky Terrier and a 23 pound Havachon. You may need more if your dog weighs more.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: so we are happy that this saved them from the torture of constant ...
customer_reviews.text: We were having troubles getting rid of fleas that we didn't even notice on the dogs but they just kept itching so we gave this a shot and since they have been taking these for over a month, they are no longer itching. We live in the country and we have woods and tall grasses that they can get into so it is a battle, but this product seems to have done the trick aside from all of the other tricks (liquid treatments, dawn dish soap baths and sprays), so we are happy that this saved them from the torture of constant itching.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Clark

customer_reviews.title: This is the 2nd time I have bought this stuff ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I have bought this stuff and it's the only thing that really works for my 2 dogs and cat . 9-1-17 a little update my dogs and cat are flea free thanks to this stuff . I will be keep buying . I swaer by this stuff .
customer_reviews.author: sabrina  pressley

customer_reviews.title: So Far Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well even though little dog is not a large fan of outdoor life in FL. Will be better tested up north for summer months where he will be outdoors more frequently. Losing or last dog to cancer, we wanted to try something made from natural substances. Tis product was recommended bya neighboe whose greyhound lives outdoors most of the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Sr.  Director

customer_reviews.title: Product did not work.
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews and the write up for this flea repellent for dogs I thought I'd give it a try. This might work for other dogs but for my 2 dachshunds and Cavalier King it was a waste of money. Oh they gobbled their table right down like it was candy but I've not seen a change to their scratching at all. I even doubled up on their dose still nothing. Next call will be to my vet. Hope you have better luck than I did. Sherry
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: So grateful for this product!
customer_reviews.text: More and more, I am turning to natural pest repellents for both myself and my dog(s). This works amazingly well and my dog eats them like candy! I'm not sure if the people who said it didn't work didn't see the part about it doesn't work until you've used it for 30 days or something, but my dog never has a single flea since I started using it and waited for it to take affect. SO much better of an option than pouring poison on her back, which has always bothered me. I love these and I'm so happy to have found something natural that I can give her that won't harm her.
customer_reviews.author: English Teacher

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Third year using this in the spring, summer, and fall for my two dogs (75 lb. short hair and 45 lb. long hair dogs) They love it, they take them as easily as they take their treats, they are out in our yard all the time and we have never had an issue with fleas or other bugs in their fur. The hardest part is remembering to start giving them out before it really gets warm, usually around March we start adding them back into our morning routine. WAY better than a greasy spot between their shoulder blades.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Works great for us
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using these for over a year and have not seen a flea on my dogs since. We live out in the county and had a massive flea infestation a couple years ago. After doing the whole flea bomb/ diatomaceous earth rigamarole, I decided to try these pills out to see if they would help. Like it says in the product description, it takes about a month or so to kick in so don't give up to quickly. I have medium sized dogs and give them each a pill before bed. They like the taste and think its a treat. Winning!
customer_reviews.author: Sa

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the previous reviews of people claiming this works great for their dogs. I did not find this to be true. We do not have a flea infestation, but the dogs did have some fleas so we bought this early on hoping to catch this before it got out of hand. After some time on this pill with no relief I switched to another product that is actually working. Not sure why this product would work for some and not others, but that is my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Mullenax

customer_reviews.title: Update!!!
customer_reviews.text: Update: so as you can see from my older post, I USE TO LOVE THIS PRODUCT! I don’t know if they changed something/ingredients or what, but my animals have the worse case of fleas right now. I’m definitely canceling my subscription! This product WORKS! I’ve been using this product for over three years and still completely satisfied!! Each year, NEVER ANY FLEAS. I do use an all natural bug spray when we go through woods and parks but I believe this also helps with mosquitos and other insects. Remember, this product builds in their system not like a topical product so I do use it all year lowering the dosage on off seasons. Try it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cla

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down!
customer_reviews.text: These did not work for my dogs. For starters they have to be crushed and added to food. Which is a pain. My dogs did not seem like their normal selves while taking these. They seemed like they didnt feel well. After a few days my dogs skin smelled like they had never been bathed. It took a while after stopping them for them to get their pep back. Used on chihuahua mix, and anatolian sheppard mix. I can see how they could work bc I bet the dog taste horrible to fleas after taking these. Topical solution works better than this. Not worth the time or trouble. Definitely NOT worth my dogs feeling like crap 24/7.
customer_reviews.author: Super Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog was miserable due to fleas. I was looking at different products to find something else to try when I saw this. After reading the reviews, I figured I wouldn't be wasting any more money trying this then buying what I'd been using. Color me shocked and amazed! Two pills a day and he's a happy poochie again. And it didn't take 30 days before we noticed a difference. We did have to give him one of those pills that kills the adult fleas 3 or 4 times the first couple weeks so it does take time but it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: It's Early Yet ...
customer_reviews.text: ...but so far I haven't seen any fleas and my 17 year old cat, Willoughby, LOVES the pills and we have fought all kinds of pill battles over the years. I have been very pleased and I live in Georgia so you KNOW we know about mosquitos.
customer_reviews.author: laura thornton

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my cat and dog. I am all about reviews and the fact that my cat has allergies, this product for him is spot on! I crush the pill up and place it into his wet food and he consumes it with ease. His neck is clearing up, he is no longer causing tears in his skin, no more welting up sores, no more major irritation on the nape of his neck. I LOVE THIS PRODUCT!!! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Diane V.

customer_reviews.title: Natural, Safe and Works
customer_reviews.text: I use "Flea Away" All Natural flea, tick and mosquito repellant - chewable tablets once daily for my two puppies (see fleaaway.com for more info). After losing my last dog to liver cancer, I swore off ever again using any chemical treatments in or around my pets - if it kills fleas and ticks then what is it doing long term to the animals. I switched to all natural Flea Away over 5 years ago and have Not had Any fleas or ticks since, and these dogs do run around the yard and take daily walks. It's liver flavored and the dogs love it, I haven't tasted them but I love what they do!
customer_reviews.author: Windy

customer_reviews.title: This really works for fleas and skin allergies!
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs who have gotten fleas the last three summers, likely from rabbits and squirrels that constantly congregate in our yard. Started giving them these pills a month before spring so it had time to build up in their systems. We are now on the second bottle of Flea Away and haven’t seen one flea on either of them. Also, one of the dogs has bad skin allergies to the point where the vet has to prescribe her steroid pills. Since she started taking these pills, she hasn’t been itching almost at all and we haven’t given her any steroids. This product is truly amazing!
customer_reviews.author: KAW

customer_reviews.title: No fleas
customer_reviews.text: I live in Texas and fleas are a real problem, I'm allergic to their bites so I can't take chances. This has saved me and my poor babygirl from being bitten by those HORRIBLE little guys! It helps with mosquitos too, my babygirl Amstaff always gets bitten up and red and she's just miserable so we found this product and wow what a difference! We tried VERY expensive flea treatments and they were not working so when we switched to this tablet I was shocked that it actually worked! I never want to be without this, I'm so glad I can order it from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Blue

customer_reviews.title: it's better than those chemicals and pesticides on our poor babys
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd year using this product. No fleas at all!!!! I did find one tick however. I will continue to buy, it's better than those chemicals and pesticides on our poor babys. I will have to continue to keep her hair short to check for ticks easily. I give it to her all your around since it's a multi vitamin if you're just starting I would suggest giving it to them two to three months before flea and tick season.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try.  We love it.
customer_reviews.text: I am on my 3rd bottle of this product. I give my dog one a day and haven't had any problem with fleas. I really am so glad I found this product! Judging by the assorted feedback this product gets I would try a bottle for yourself to see if it works. I'm sure there are many variables on whether this product is going to work on your animal or not. Doesn't hurt to give it a try. My dog seems to love it too. She eats it right up. I put it in her food bowl every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Hardworkingwoman

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased
customer_reviews.text: An natural oral flea repellant. I was skeptical. But my dogs all love it. And my have couple picky pooches. The best part is I do see a difference. I love that I can prevent the fleas naturally.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brewster

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my 2 lions ^.".^  ^.''.^ !
customer_reviews.text: Have been giving this in my cat's food (2 cats) and have not seen a flea all summer. There have been a couple of tiny ticks on one of my cat's eyes they were short lived. We live in the woods...typically I would be removing ticks from the cats all summer.
customer_reviews.author: Markels Roberts

customer_reviews.title: It works  great if used properly
customer_reviews.text: Had feral cat give birth outside 6 months ago. Feeding 6 feral cats. I crush the pills in a garlic presser and add half a teaspoon daily to each bowl of wet food every AM for first 30 days. Mix well. Then same amount every other day. Do not use in dry food. It won't work. I keep a premium dry food out and fill as needed, but also do wet in AM only. No more fleas plus their coats look fantastic. You must be consistant daily and it will work wonders for your cats.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie  Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my dog everyday for 30+ days and the fleas only got worse. I can't believe that a product you have to use (per the label) for at least 30 days to see results does not offer a return after 30 days???? how does that make sense. Had to resort from a flea pill from the vet and the fleas were dying within hours after my dog took it? I would like a full refund but looks doubtful
customer_reviews.author: Merchant King Services

customer_reviews.title: Second year using these.
customer_reviews.text: After years of using Frontline, my three dogs started running away from me when they saw me coming with the applicator in my hand. It is not that these are delicious and they eat them up, I wrap hamburger around the pill and they eat it up. I know how important it is for outside dogs to be tick free, so that's what I do to keep them that way.
customer_reviews.author: florence anne johannes

customer_reviews.title: I believe these pills are working.
customer_reviews.text: With summer coming up I wanted to get a head start on flea and tick infestation so I bought these pills for my two dogs. So far I haven't seen my male border terrier scratch, I've seen my female scratch once or twice a day. My male dog has been chewing these pills one per day (longer than my female dog which is probably why he isn't scratching). My female dog wouldn't take them at first, she kept rejecting them. Now she eats one every day like my male dog and I believe these pills are working.
customer_reviews.author: Vikki Divine

customer_reviews.title: We have had a really bad flea season here in Florida the last two years ...
customer_reviews.text: We have had a really bad flea season here in Florida the last two years because we never really got a cold snap. The fleas are horrible and I have been fighting them with no luck until now. This product does work but it does take about 4 weeks to notice and a few more weeks for them to be gone. Just keep in mind that this repels them so you have to do your due diligence to treat the house and yard or you will still be suffering from fleas even though your pet isn't
customer_reviews.author: CDC74

customer_reviews.title: Helps keeps the bugs away.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second bottle. I ran out and didn't buy another until now. As spring came so did the little critters that gets into her fur. I kept forgetting to reorder until she was scratching almost every minute. I got another bottle and within a couple of days her scratching was reduced by more than 50% and getting better daily. She does not like the flea collars and managed to get it off her neck once. As she likes these tablets I will continue using them.
customer_reviews.author: MIMI

customer_reviews.title: Texas Fleas!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have three dogs and a house cat, and they were always scratching, even in the middle of the night!!! We wanted something natural without the harsh chemicals. You don't notice the improvement right away but on the second day, they were scratching less. Now it's the fourth day and they are doing great, no attacks of scratching fits!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Barrientes

customer_reviews.title: No fleas or ticks in over a year.
customer_reviews.text: I have had my dog on Flea Away for over a year. I will NEVER run out of this product, I have not found one flea or tick on her since she has been on it. I used to treat my yard for fleas, but with this product I don't have to. Even out in the country she stays free of them. My dog is highly allergic to fleas so this has been a life saver for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sabra Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money , get spray instead!
customer_reviews.text: This was my second purchase of these pills for my dog. The first one's really seemed to help keep the fleas off of my boy , but with this second order, it did nothing. I was finding flea's every other day and at $34.00 for two bottles I feel like I wasted money! I won't get them again.
customer_reviews.author: The PinUp Girl2BTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Flea & Tick Protection
customer_reviews.text: We have not seen a flea or tick on our dog since starting to use this product. We had been using Nexgard which is a RX medication for dogs through our vet. This was getting more and more expensive ($235/year) and has chemicals in it that we really did not want to give our older dog. We switched to this formula about a year ago and have not had ANY fleas or ticks on our dog. IT WORKS!!! The dog doesn't like the taste of the tablets so we break it up in her food and she gets it every day.
customer_reviews.author: BJE

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pills
customer_reviews.text: Both my dog AND my cat are finicky eaters and they BOTH love these tablets. I was happy to find them at the old price. No matter how great an item is, the price is a factor and as long as I can afford them, I'll buy these pills. And BTW: the fur on my cat is richer and fluffy since she takes these pills. My dog was bitten by another dog and the wound healed really fast and the fur grew well on top, no bald spots! Might be because of these pills.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: If you buy this product, keep an eye on your dog for any reactions.
customer_reviews.text: This item was returned. My chihuahua's whose hair was black, beautiful & so soft to touch suddenly had white spots & his hair Became brittle & started calling out. Thankfully my Vet said we caught it before it did any permanent damage.
customer_reviews.author: Judy D

customer_reviews.title: FLEA AWAY is a DUD
customer_reviews.text: Glowing reports from previous buyers on this product but it did NOT work on either my cat or dog. First day dog loved the "horse" pill; cat ate about 1/4. Next day - "FORGET IT"; neither were interested even when I tried to hand feed or added to soft food - both dodged it. Big disappointment to me as I felt sure this was a WINNER to solve the flea epidemic that I think we're all having this dry Summer.
customer_reviews.author: Karolyn Oman

customer_reviews.title: easy to crush into food for cats
customer_reviews.text: I have an outside cat....faral. He doesn't mind being fed but if he hears the snap of a chemical flea formula he's gone. Now, this product says it takes 30 days to be fully functional, and it has not yet been 30 days, but it has been very easy to feed. I have a mortar and pestle and the tablet crushes easily. I grind it up to a powder and mix it in with the Friskies Pate and down it goes. I'm anxious to see if it does the job and if it does it will definitely go on a regular "every three month" order. Keep you're fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: Kruser

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: One dog was starting to scratch. Flea baths kept under control. Got this to make sure other dogs wouldn’t get them. Flea baths continued, House and yard treated as usual. Wanted to try these instead of my usual go to since I have a dog with yeast issues -but these didn’t help. Now all of them have fleas. Hard to get the older two to eat them. Puppies gobble them up and still not helping. I usually get any issue under control within a week. Not with these.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly C.

customer_reviews.title: for my pets Just not going to work.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews good and bad and figured why not. Maybe I would be on the good side. With two cats and a dog that eats anything. The cats just looked at me like I was crazy. when mixing in their food they turned away the entire meal. As for the dog he ate it after I tried many times but wasn't happy about it. So after only a few tries I give up. The price is good and the idea seems good but for my pets Just not going to work.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: These break and crumble really easily. I put them in my dogs food as ...
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten this as a try it basically. We live in the country and fleas and ticks are a huge problem. With daily use, we had limited tick problems and no fleas. Do not miss doses. It does take a few days to start working. These break and crumble really easily. I put them in my dogs food as they kept spitting them out. My dogs are under 10 lbs. I give them half a pill every day.
customer_reviews.author: ruth mccaleb

customer_reviews.title: great for a small dog
customer_reviews.text: We live in the country where ticks and fleas are plentiful. Before using this product, my 10 lbs dog gets ticks every few days. Four at a time someday. We have kids, so we don't want to use harmful chemical for prevention. ... 3 weeks or so after giving this product every morning,,, Ticks magically disappeared from my dog's body. I looked into similar products with more value and better reviews, but some ingredients like garlic are toxic for dog. Long term use won't worth the money saved. I will stick to this product. It works for us.
customer_reviews.author: yk

customer_reviews.title: After a month of use I only see a rare ...
customer_reviews.text: After a month of use I only see a rare and occasional flea and my dogs and cats were nearly infested. There are none in the house and you can tell a difference in their coats. This was used after one dose of topical flea meds to break the infestation and has worked well since. Now the cycle is broken and I only give them a pill every other day. For my cats I gave them half a pill. Definitely will be reordering these.
customer_reviews.author: Queen Jo Dee

customer_reviews.title: It didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: So I really wanted this to help! It didn’t do anything. I’m just giving it to my dog just to use it up. I tried every natural way to get rid of fleas on her and in my home/yard. Not a single natural thing worked. Ultimately, I had to give her nexgard and chemicals all in my yard/house. Still fighting these darn fleas! Waiting for winter then getting on top of it before next summer comes! Fleas are horrible!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M Mares

customer_reviews.title: Dog are my what???!!!
customer_reviews.text: Soooo, youve all heard " my dog ate my homework, the couch, fill in the blank"! I had not even opened this and my dog got the cap off, inner seal off, and ate them all! So I can tell you dogs love the taste! No i'll effects but boy is she flea free!
customer_reviews.author: lora pirwitz

customer_reviews.title: Kitty says yum.
customer_reviews.text: I give Spooky his vitamin first thing in the morning, HIS choice as he loves these things! He drools until it's in his mouth. Indoor cat but no bugs and very healthy. He's a large breed (Weegy) and is growing fast at 2-1/2 y/o in the pic by the bus. The pics are 2 years apart. Leash trained and follows commands very well.
customer_reviews.author: Donald D

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Gave these to my dog daily and he still ended up.covered in tucks several times. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful fur coat and no fleas!
customer_reviews.text: This product has helped a stray cat (about 7 years old according to the vet) gain back health and a beautiful fur coat. Her fur was dull and lacklustre. She was flea bitten when I brought her home and since our other cat reacted negatively to Revolution I wanted something natural. Although she doesn't go outside except with me on a harness and leash, she has had no flea issues since I started using this product. I cannot say how it would work for an outdoor cat, but for our mostly indoor cat who lives with us on the edge of a forest, it works. I am reordering.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi S. Fluharty

customer_reviews.title: My animals love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I moved to a house that was a major fixer upper... and flea's came with it! I've been giving my dogs these pills and thankfully they have helped. One dog (out of 6 dogs) Had flea's. I bathed her with dawn dishsoap.. (it kills flea's just so you know) and continued to give her these pills and no more flea's! None of my other dog's got flea's from my one dog.. I would like to think the pills helped them all not get it. I recommend trying these to see if they work for yours!
customer_reviews.author: Jillybean

customer_reviews.title: great results
customer_reviews.text: Previously used expensive chewable tablets from vet, decided to try these natural tablets & they've worked really well. My 3-yr old Cocker Spaniel eats one a day with his dog food, doesn't even notice it. Fleas were terrible for him last year so started these early. Seem to be working very well. Label says the natural contents mask the odor of Co2 which attracts the insects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth a shot, I thought they helped
customer_reviews.text: My cat caught on to me breaking these up and putting them in his food after a week. Started crushing them up and mixing them into wet food which he was actually eating and I think it was helping. He was really fighting them, it never turned into a full infestation while I was treating him with these. If nothing else it's tool in the war against fleas. It was a little rough waiting 30 days for the effects to kick in... but it seemed to help!
customer_reviews.author: RICK W.

customer_reviews.title: So far it's helping
customer_reviews.text: This summer was the worst when it came to fleas in my apartment. My dog is allergic to the oral flea and tick medication so I have to use topical that doesn't work well and all sorts of measures. This had reduced the amount of fleas on her as well as what I see in the apartment. She still has a few but no where near the amount that she had prior. She loves the taste of them. In the beginning she was having lose bowel movements but that has since stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Bizzell

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT IS DANGEROUS!!!!!! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a severe reaction to this product. First he sneezed excessively, then rubbed his nose into carpet frantically, he cried in a very strange way, when I called his name he looked at me with this glaze over his eyes he looked very HIGH! After sleeping for almost two days straight he finally started acting normal again. I am extremely dissatisfied this product is dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: BMD

customer_reviews.title: Finicky Cats LOVE These Treats!
customer_reviews.text: My super finicky cats love their Flea Away vitamins, and all are showing signs of terrific improvement! The two girls are allergic to fleas - tormented by bites long after the flea is gone. The male is less sensitive, but still was having problems. The fleas are not yet completely gone, but tremendously reduced, and the allergic reactions have stopped! Amazing! I break the tablet in 2 - not just easier to eat, but this makes the scent of the pill much stronger, and all 3 scarf it right up! I am so pleased, and I recommend this to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Kat McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: They just don’t work
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that my dog and my cat both loved the taste of these pills and ate them by themselves like treats. I did not like the fact that they didn’t work. I also don’t like the fact you can’t get a refund after the 30 days have passed and that the pills don’t “work” until they have been ingested by your pet for 30 continuous days. I was very diligent and gave my animals this product daily at the same time since receiving it. Both of my animals still have fleas and my cat never goes outside
customer_reviews.author: howard j eaves

customer_reviews.title: Works great & smells like a vitamin
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I first got this, but was so frustrated that the stuff that works is by prescription only & costs so darn much! I started using these pills for my dogs & they eat them up and my pups haven't had an uninvited guest yet! I am sold on these. The value is fantastic and the pups seem to like them. 1 a day for my smaller pups & 2 per day for my big guy! For under $20 per month, I've been able to take care of our 3 fur babies all summer long.
customer_reviews.author: patty gardner

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good - no fleas!
customer_reviews.text: Our rescue dog apparently is very allergic to flea bites. We try to use all-natural products for him & so far this seems to have worked as we've not seen fleas on him since we started using it. We're doing several other things too, so could be a combination of them all, but we like the nutrients in it, so will continue to give it to him long as we're getting good results.
customer_reviews.author: NaturalNana

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Dislike that it takes 30 days, but once 30 days are in effect i did like how it boosted fur growth and shine. My dog had been dealing with flea bites and fleas all summer and finally found something to keep fleas to a bare minimum of atleast 2 fleas being found, thats on avg every other week. The garlic smell was harsh for a bit on her breath but once balanced with a teeth cleaner treat it got better.
customer_reviews.author: Taneka Austin

customer_reviews.title: Don't like this product have 4 cats and a big dog ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't like this product have 4 cats and a big dog and gives the required amount to each animal and they still have a problem with please haven't noticed fleas going away not as good as the last product I was using from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Sharyn Rawls

customer_reviews.title: My experience with a 2 year old Vizsla
customer_reviews.text: She willingly took the pils, must taste good. After taking them for 4-5 days , she woke up with a crazed look and was like a dog on crack or pcp. She ran through our fence. After I found her she barked non stop, ran for hours, wouldn’t listen and ate and pooped way more than normal. She wasn’t the same dog. This was the only change in her life. After not taking it for 2 days, she’s back to normal. I’m not trying to speak bad of a product with good reviews. Just wanted to share the experience and effect on breed of dog (vizsla).
customer_reviews.author: hak13

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product for 3 weeks and did not see any effects. I even gave my dogs flea baths before starting to give them this daily pill, which they loved, but was not effective whatsoever at repelling or killing fleas. I will use it until it's gone but will not re-order, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Angel

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I have a pit bull mix and a chihuahua that both have been taking these. The product really works and my dogs enjoy them like a treat. However, they do give my dogs awful gas. I guess it would depend on your dog if their stomach can handle this product or not.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa R.

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for 3 outside cats that have flea allergies and I have no way of treating with flea drops. In 30 days I have seen the difference in their coat is shiny, healthy, no scratching. I have purchased a second container. To the manufacturer: would be nice if it would be made in capsules tat is open and the product mixed in the food, as it is in a tablet it needs to be crushed.
customer_reviews.author: Liza M.

customer_reviews.title: They really eat it!
customer_reviews.text: We have a rescue cat who is very suspicious and nervous and she would never let us put the liquid flea medicine on her neck like we do for her sister. We weren't sure if Molly would eat these, but we mixed them in with her treats and she at them right up. We let them out in the yard and they have not had any tick or flea issues. Win/win!
customer_reviews.author: LuLu

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff, I have a big Male that seems to have flea sticky paper as fur and it's like he's constantly walking thus a field of fleas, I got this stuff and did the usual treatment of Bayer tree and shroud ( non-toxic and works so well, wet your critter pour some in your hand and slather it on said critter, works like a charm) use this with it and voila Bob's yer uncle no more fleas
customer_reviews.author: MagicWeaver

customer_reviews.title: This chewable herbal product works better than or as well as stinky poisons
customer_reviews.text: This chewable herbal product works better than or as well as stinky poisons. My dog does not like pills, so I coat them with a tiny bit of olive oil. He willingly eats the morning dose. He will not eat the afternoon dose, but the smooth ends and my coating of oil make them easy to insert and swallow.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Ellinghouse

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have a small dog and a cat. I used this flea product for both. The first month I still saw some fleas. After that there have been no fleas. I have used this product for about a year. The cat is mostly outside so I was surprised how well it worked on her. Pam , Bacca and Kitty Kat.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the positive reviews we decided to purchase the tablets for our three cats. I crushed the tabs and mixed with wet food every morning for 45 days with zero positive results. I wanted this to work but all three cats showed no improvement. I threw away the remaining product and am writing this review.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Erskine Miller

customer_reviews.title: Sadly did not work for my pups
customer_reviews.text: Even living in a suburban neighborhood, these unfortunately did not work for my pups. However, I began using them after they were already infested. Once I have that under control, I will begin using these pills again in conjunction with a topical. And continue use year round in an effort to help control the fleas.
customer_reviews.author: wmbarbie

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t give this product 5 stars only because I just received it and the description says it takes 30 days to really take effect. But I’m into Day 2 and am pleased because my cats take it no problem... I don’t even have to mix it into their food. So if it works for them as well as it tastes to them, then this product deserves 5 Big Stars.
customer_reviews.author: April Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: NO FLEAS!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I live in a rural area and I had problems with fleas and ticks on my 2 dogs. The pills from the vet are too expensive for my budget. This products has gotten rid of the fleas and ticks from my dogs. I just crumble it into their food and they eat it right up. No mess, no problems!!
customer_reviews.author: Ida G.

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd year & no fleas!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second year using this product and I’m absolutely amazed at how well it works. I have 2 huskies & live in Texas. I started giving them, each 1 pill a day at the beginning of spring & all throughout the summer until fall. Since I’ve been giving them these pills I haven’t found one flea on either of them.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Jean Lackey

customer_reviews.title: Don't work
customer_reviews.text: I don't think it has done anything for my dogs! My 2 are infested with fleas (get these daily) while my daughter often firgwts to give our other dog hers and she only has a couple! They are chewable and the dogs are supposed to like them but none of my 3 like them. I have to out then in their food each am.
customer_reviews.author: Reay Clan

customer_reviews.title: It truly works
customer_reviews.text: We were skeptical when we got this, but we are no longer. After 3 weeks of use we were starting to see signs of its working, the cats were scratching less and less, after 4 weeks it appears to be working well. We give it once daily in their food, to the outside and inside cats and everyone appears to be flea free. We plan on continuing to use this through the entire flea season
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: The pills appear to work great. I used them on all of my 3 dogs ranging in weight from 5 lbs. to 5o lbs. The two smaller ones I gave them 1/2 a pill which worked very quickly & the big hound I gave a full pill to & it started working within 1 hour. They are worth the money, I just wish the flavor was stronger so I didn't have to hide them in hotdogs.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Carlton

customer_reviews.title: Quick delivery, and made a difference.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We have 3 dogs who bring in fleas to cats. Has definitely made a difference. We use vectrol also. Fleas were especially bad this year. Were bringing in fleas from walks, and made a noticeable difference.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: This is the first week that I been giving it to my dogs, I kinda see a bit of results, but still will wait to see better results, like my dogs not scratching at all, 2 of my dogs like the pill straight, they think is a snack, but one did not care for the pill, so I have to break it and hide it in the food
customer_reviews.author: Anngie

customer_reviews.title: Still questioning whether it works or not
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to give my picky eating dogs. however after reading the bottle once I received I noticed that it takes up to at least 30 days to start working. Wish they came in bigger counts. As I have multiple animals. On day five of trying them have not seen no reflection of it working or not working. Will try one more supply of a month and go from there
customer_reviews.author: Barbie battease

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a allergy. He got so bad he had lost hair patches. He was treated once with Nexgaurd. I will probably increase the dose in summer. His hair is back but his ears still bother him even when one dose is missed. It recommends one pill I double it for my large dog and half for my small. One of my dogs seems a little tired when taking it, I don't give it to him as often. Just when he scratches a lot or is going to be outside a lot.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Did not work!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work! I see this product has good reviews, so obviously it does work for some dogs. But it did not work for mine. Not at all. Yard and home were completely and professionally treated several times. Probably did an overkill on that, but didn’t want to take a chance. Had to switch product to something else...
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will continue to order again and again
customer_reviews.text: It's not the peak of flea season but here in Georgia there really hasn't been a winter. My cat is the "Carrier" as we are more her people than she our cat and she comes and goes as she pleases. She has no issue eating this pill so long as it's broken in two and placed on top her food like a cherry on an ice cream. We haven't seen a flea on her since we began the product so I have high hopes for Spring!
customer_reviews.author: Beth R

customer_reviews.title: This is the real deal for Oregon & my cat DOES love them!
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Willamette Valley in Western Oregon - we are a hotbed of fleas, ticks, etc. I have a 1 year old white non-specific kitten who comes to me just by rattling the bottle! She has been flea-less for 8 months - no joke - she had MAJOR issues & no more! I also have a 65-lb 4 year old rescue dog who ALSO had issues, but seriously no more. Kitten takes 1 pill & dog gets 2 pills per day - I feed them right before their dinner so the nutrients are immediately absorbed. Could not be more pleased. THANK YOU AC Kerman Pet Products!
customer_reviews.author: PaynelessPC

customer_reviews.title: The pills are large and my cats are suspicious of ...
customer_reviews.text: The pills are large and my cats are suspicious of it, so I break it in two and put it in their food bowl. It gets eaten and my cats don't have fleas this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Cher

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff! You do have to give it to your dogs every day for about a month before it actually works. And then if you don't give it to them for a couple of days, they start itching again. I use this in addition with Advantix/Frontline type flea stuff. I have labs who itch A LOT and this product does the job. I tell everyone about it!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Concord

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves the taste!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros; My dog loves the taste of them & eats them right up! Cons: she gets 2 capsules a day because she is a Labrador However she still seems to chase fleas on herself! 🤷‍♀️ She has only been on them a couple weeks so hopefully after we finish up the bottle that willbe good!
customer_reviews.author: Approach!

customer_reviews.title: Flea Away All Natural
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily for three dogs. Honestly, it works. I do check my dogs often during tick season though. Only 1 time out of a year did I find 1 tick. Just good to always check for ticks. I have not had any flea problems at all. Very thankful for that. When you have more than 1 dog, this was a great inexpensive way to keep them safe from fleas and ticks.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This one a day pill actually works. I live in Florida so it is flea weather almost all the time. My Dachsund spends a great deal of time outdoors and he has not had a single flea on him since I have been giving him these pills. No mosquito bites, no tick bites. Very satisfied. Biggest issue is getting him to take it. It must not smell appetizing but without too much coaxing her eats it.
customer_reviews.author: dukeofnuke

customer_reviews.title: Not for sensitive stomachs
customer_reviews.text: I have a morkie (Maltese Yorkie mix). I wanted to try a natural flea repellent. This one had good reviews, so I decided to give it a try. I gave one pill to my morkie (she is about 8lbs). She threw up shortly afterwards. The next day I tried it again and she threw up. I stopped. If your dog has a sensitive stomach, he or she may or may not react well with this. Two positives were that it was easy for my morkie to chew and she liked the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Love Flea Away
customer_reviews.text: This product works great for our 2 Shitzus. Have been using is now for a full year and have absolutely no flea problem. Before I used all the standard natural and vet prescriptions, they helped, but they are poisonous and they also still get the red rash on their belly, because the fleas get on them and bite them before they die. With Flea away, no fleas, no red rash because the fleas never get on them. We live in Texas and have a huge flea problem. I am very happy with the product. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Patsydoe

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this supplement for my 14 year old husky mix because I didn't want anymore chemicals added to her system. She is arthritic and is already on meds for that, so I opted to discontinue the vet's recommended Bravecto and put her on Flea Away. She has been taking two caplets/day for a month now, and so far, no fleas or ticks have gotten on her. I hoping this continues in the future!!
customer_reviews.author: Cilla

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for cats
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT meant for cats. They are horse pill sized and not capsules so no way to give them to my cat. Waste of money if you're buying for cats.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie F

customer_reviews.title: Flea Away All Natural Flea, Tick, and Mosquito Repellent for Dogs and Cats, 100 Chewable Tablets
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in a timely manner and well packaged. These seem to work very well. (Sometimes our doggie eats them but sometimes we have to sneak them in food, depending on her mood.) It takes almost a month to see results, but our dog has stopped scratching. Would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lineberry

customer_reviews.title: Dogs like the taste, but does it work.
customer_reviews.text: Dogs like the taste so its easy to give. The only reason I am giving it a 3 star is because I am not sure that it works. Golden retriever has been taking 2 pills a day for 2weeks and we pulled 4 ticks off him this morning. Maybe he needs to be taking it for a longer period, not sure.
customer_reviews.author: roses r red

customer_reviews.title: Making my dogs sick
customer_reviews.text: This product worked for the first few weeks but then started making both of my dogs sick. They were having diarrhea, vomiting and had loud stomach gurgling. They refused to eat their food too. This was the only thing in their diet that had changed. The day we stopped it, they felt a lot better and got back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: ruth

customer_reviews.title: I have seen mosquitoes turn in mid air and fly away from my dog!
customer_reviews.text: My Rottie mix has been on this product for over a year. He takes two tabs a day, has never had a flea or a tick either. My last dog had tick fever and I wanted to make sure Colby had every chance. The bonus is a thick fluffy beautiful coat! Would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Robin B

customer_reviews.title: Too large for a cat as is... but make a nice powder
customer_reviews.text: Although the pills are too big for a cat as is they are soft and with a pill crusher make a nice powder. The powder can be mixed with wet food and/or sprinkled on dry food. As far as I can tell they do work as promised. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Coyote Jack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Feral Cato can’t get near my feral cat, but since he eaktsqwq
customer_reviews.text: I can’t get close to my Feral Cat, but as he comes into my porch to eat twice daily, he isn’t always scratching fleas and possibly dropping them on the floor. I do wish they were smaller as I have to heat them up under his wet food to fool him into eating them.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: I started using this on my German Shepherd for both ...
customer_reviews.text: I started using this on my German Shepherd for both ticks and fleas. It seems to be it's working she hardly scatchs anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Corella

customer_reviews.title: Not Chewable for Most Cats
customer_reviews.text: It seems the product does prevent flea infestation on our long Himalayan cat, but we also use Frontline Gold. I would prefer to use the tablet but don’t dare after what I can only call Flea Hell infestations. My one complaint is that they are not really chewable for cats. I have to use a pill slicer to cut each one in half and then give it twice a day. Seems there could be a way to make the contents in a soft chew.
customer_reviews.author: SheilaG

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I am editing my review because i took my dog to the vet and he said the vitamins are not the cause of my dogs fur falling off. She said these are okay to give to my 22 lb. terrier mix. My dog really likes these as much as regular treats. Fleas did go away. Keep in mind bottle says it takes up to 30 days to see results ans did not make fur shiny.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

product_meta.title: Flea Away All Natural Flea, Tick, and Mosquito Repellent for Dogs and Cats, 100 Chewable Tablets
product_meta.description: Size:2 PackFlea Away is a vitamin complex, specifically formulated for dogs and cats. Flavored with real liver, your pet will love them! What makes Flea Away different from alternate flea repellents is that fleas don't get on the dog or cat's skin and bite before finding chemicals and going away. The pests simply stay away from your pet because of the odor (undetected by humans) that your pets skin gives off. With Flea Away your dog or cat's skin gives off a natural smell caused by the special safe mixture of vitamins. If your dog or cat has an allergic reaction to flea bites, then Flea Away is the way to go. The fleas, ticks and mosquitoes are naturally repelled before biting your pet. Dosage: Cats: 1 chewable tablet 1 time daily. Dogs: Up to 50 pounds - 1 tablet 1 time daily, 51 to 100 pounds - 2 tablets 1 time daily, 101 to 150 pounds - 3 tablets 1 time daily. Please allow 30 days of use before seeing results as product needs to be in the system. 2 Pack.
feature_bullets: ALL NATURAL: Flea Away is a vitamin complex, made to FDA human standards and specifically formulated for dogs and cats, creating a natural and safe barrier from fleas, ticks and mosquitos.
NO PESTICIDES: Flea Away repels fleas, ticks, & mosquitoes naturally, with no toxic chemicals or residue.  Safe for both nursing mother and her litter.
ADDITIONAL BENEFITS: Our vitamin complex promotes healthier skin, reduces shedding, shinier coat, better joints and is liver flavored. Your pet will love them!
NO MORE BITES: The difference from alternate flea repellents is with Flea Away, fleas are naturally repelled before biting your pet.  Helps dogs and cats with allergic reaction to flea bites.
DOSAGE: Every day, it will take less than 30 days for you pet to build up the appropriate level to fight off pests.  Sourced and manufactured in the USA for year round use

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
